query: What discrepancies exist between verbal representations and written proposals?
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: What discrepancies exist between verbal representations and written proposals?

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Ask whether this history should have triggered concern for new discrepancies at the 192-month check.

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
You would agree that a G550 with 16 years of service is likely to have corrosion and other discrepancies?

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Yet you included no estimate of time or cost impact for discrepancies—correct?

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Nowhere does it mention the 20,000+ manhours typically incurred when discrepancies are found?

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
A range of estimated discrepancies ($250K–$400K).

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Klebe's internal decks (e.g. GAC0000173) include customer-facing "Downtime Talking Points." If they avoid discussing discrepancies, that omission becomes an admission. Ask:

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
“So your peers—your own affiliate—include ROM costs for discrepancies, but Gulfstream doesn’t?”

[Danny Farnham Direct Outline with Cross & Redirect.docx, p.1]
1. “We couldn’t have known discrepancies would arise”

[Danny Farnham Direct Outline with Cross & Redirect.docx, p.1]
Beauchemin / Hassan Defense: Major inspections uncover hidden discrepancies—no way to predict.

[Danny Farnham Direct Outline with Cross & Redirect.docx, p.1]
Standard practice is to flag “likely discrepancies” and offer ROM estimates based on similar projects.

[CITIOM v. Gulfstream - Gulfstream's Responses to CITIOM's Requests for Admission (2025.04.21).pdf, p.3]
Admit that Respondent did not disclose the existence or use of the New

[CITIOM v. Gulfstream - Gulfstream's Responses to CITIOM's Requests for Admission (2025.04.21).pdf, p.4]
the 192- month inspection related to conditions that existed or should have been addressed during

[Joe Schuster Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Confirm that weekend and holiday coverage was minimal or nonexistent (Farnham p. 14; PHB p. 14).

[1-110.pdf, p.62]
Thanks. Charge to existing work order.



Based on document search, key findings:
- Found relevant excerpts in repository documents
- See excerpts above for specific citations
